intro: Trichelostylis chaetorrhiza, commonly known as the hairy root fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery fronds. The plant has a short, thick rhizome with dense, hairy roots, which contribute to its common name. Its foliage is typically bright green and thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate and elegant appearance.
